    • Method Detail

      • validateIdentity

        public void validateIdentity(String accessToken)
                      throws OAuthVerificationException
        Validates the supplied access token against this OAuth Idp. Validation is done by making a request to the user info endpoint to determine if the provided access token is valid on the Idp. If it is valid, a user profile is returned, from which we will extract the subject that we will use to query a known profile later to determine if there is an account associated with that subject.
        Specified by:
        validateIdentity in interface OAuthResolver
        Parameters:
        accessToken - access token to verify.
        Throws:
        OAuthVerificationException - if the accessToken is unable to be verified

        Description copied from interface: OAuthResolver
        Returns the subject used to link the identity provider account to known account information.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the subject which to associate the user to
